again posting useless posts after he already got his answer
[/quote]

His post was more helpful than yours, by the way, the post im quoting is quite useless isnt it?

@cats, you missed something
playerRights > 1 is not the same as playerRights == 2

^ this means anything greater than 1 ^ this means is equal to 2, nothing less or greater

just pointing that out, not saying youre wrong or anything ;)[/quote]
its basic math, anything above the playerRights 1, and you can use the command
iz liek, amg wtfz

1 > 0

lol

item.title: Commands lil confused :s
item.dc:creator: @CatsGoMeow CatsGoMeow
item.description:
@CatsGoMeow wrote:

[quote=“sone14, post:1, topic:353290”]commands look like this in my server

    if (command.startsWith("item") && playerRights > 1) {
	        String[] args = command.split(" ");
         if(args.length == 3) {
		int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
		int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
			addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
		} else {
			sM("No such item.");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Type like this  ::item ID AMOUNT");
	}
    }

}

from what i see it says player rights >1 that means less than 1? i want to add commands for mods and admin, for mods i want to add mute, admins i want to add jail and unjail, and for owner i want to add hail, how will i do this?[/quote]

Basic Maths Lesson:

1 > 0

This means one is greater than 0.

1 < 2

This means 1 is smaller than 2.

x = 1

This means x is equal to 1.

if (playerRights >= 1)

This means if the player rights are greater than or equal to.

tl;dr You have to be a mod or above to use that command.

Only admins can use the command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("admincommand") && playerRights > 1)
{
sM("Hello!");
}

playerRights > 1 is same as playerRights == 2.

Anything else?

Read full topic

item.title: Commands lil confused :s
item.dc:creator: @lostbro lostbro
item.description:
@lostbro wrote:

for commands player rights go as followed: 0 = member, 1 = moderator, 2 = administrator, 3 = owner, 4 = hidden admin,
for other commands to be staff only make a && playerRights > 1) { " if u make it 1 its for a mod + command, 2 admin + and so on.

item.title: Commands lil confused :s
item.dc:creator: @sone14 sone14
item.description:
@sone14 wrote:

commands look like this in my server

    if (command.startsWith("item") && playerRights > 1) {
	        String[] args = command.split(" ");
         if(args.length == 3) {
		int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
		int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
			addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
		} else {
			sM("No such item.");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Type like this  ::item ID AMOUNT");
	}
    }

}

from what i see it says player rights >1 that means less than 1? i want to add commands for mods and admin, for mods i want to add mute, admins i want to add jail and unjail, and for owner i want to add hail, how will i do this?
